snippet: Police officers raided the offices of an American-financed project that offers services to AIDS patients, a government spokesman said Friday, in what appeared to be the first public action to enforce a new anti-homosexuality law.
abstract: Ugandan police officers raid offices of American-financed project that offers services to AIDS patients; move appears to be the first public action to enforce a new anti-homosexuality law.
lead_paragraph: Police officers raided the offices of an American-financed project that offers services to AIDS patients, a government spokesman said Friday, in what appeared to be the first public action to enforce a new anti-homosexuality law.

headline.main: Uganda: Police Raid U.S.-Financed Health Project
headline.print_headline: Uganda: Police Raid U.S.-Financed Health Project
